abstract: Op-Ed article by Carolyn N Lerner, head of United States Office of Special Counsel, notes she has sent Congress proposed legislation to fix Hatch Act of 1939, law that was originally intended to keep improper politics out of federal workplace; contends law, in its current form, prevents would-be candidates in state and local races from running because of negligible ties to federal funding in their private lives.
snippet: The Hatch Act can prevent would-be candidates in state and local races from running because they are in some way tied to a source of federal funds in their professional lives.
